James Watt's improvements of what were fundamental to the changes wrought by the Industrial Revolution?	The steam engine.

James Watt was born where?	Greenock, a seaport on the Firth of Clyde
What was the name of James Watt's mother?	Agnus Muirhead
What was the name of James Watt's mother?	Agnes Muirhead
How many of James Watt's children did not live to adulthood?	3
How many of James Watt's children did not live to adulthood?	3
James Watt ranked first among how many people in Charles Murray's survey of historiometry?	229
James Watt ranked first among how many people in Charles Murray's survey of historiometry?	229
In what year did James travel to Lodon to study instrument-making?	1753
For how many years of James Watt's life was his mother alive?	17 years
What is James Watt most famous for?	Steam engine.
